intro: Hedyotis pressa, commonly known as smallleaf bittersweet, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants known for their medicinal properties. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom in early summer. Hedyotis pressa typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is characterized by its slender stems and red-tinted berries that ripen in the fall.
